column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of AlFe2B2 were prepared by arc-melting pure Al, Fe and B elements under argon atmosphere.
#Text=The starting materials were lumps of Al (99.9%), Fe (99.9%) and B (99.5%).
#Text=Previous studies have showed that an excess amount of Al is essential to curb the formation of undesired Al13Fe4 and to achieve better phase purity of AlFe2B2.
#Text=Therefore, the synthesis procedure as described in Ref. [7] was adopted and Al, Fe and B mixed in ratio 3:2:2 were melted in an arc furnace.
#Text=The button was flipped and remelted several times to achieve better homogeneity.

#Text=The XRD analysis of as-prepared material showed the presence of impurity phase Al13Fe4 which was removed by soaking small pieces of the material in dilute HCl for ten minutes which resulted in small porous granules of the material.
